requirements.text: Implement the "No üíî" button as an evasive button using CSS position: fixed. The button must move to a new random position anywhere within the full viewport (window.innerWidth/window.innerHeight) while always staying fully visible on screen (account for the button‚Äôs width/height).

quotes:
NO BUTTON BEHAVIOR (VERY IMPORTANT):

- The "No" button must be an EVASIVE BUTTON.
- It should be impossible to click intentionally.

TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS (IMPORTANT):

- Position the "No" button using position: fixed (not relative or absolute inside a container).
- Randomize its top and left values based on window.innerWidth and window.innerHeight.
- Ensure the button always stays fully visible inside the screen boundaries.

acceptanceCriteria: The "No üíî" button uses fixed positioning (not confined to a parent container).
Each move sets a new (top,left) within viewport bounds such that the entire button remains visible.
Randomization uses the current viewport size (innerWidth/innerHeight) and adapts when the viewport size changes.
The "No üíî" button can appear anywhere on screen (not only within the centered content area).

requirements.text: Desktop interaction: when the mouse cursor hovers over or enters the "No üíî" button, it must immediately jump to a new random fixed position within the full viewport.

quotes:
DESKTOP BEHAVIOR:

- When the mouse cursor comes near or hovers over the "No" button,
it should instantly jump to a RANDOM position anywhere on the FULL SCREEN

acceptanceCriteria: On desktop, moving the mouse onto the "No üíî" button triggers an immediate position change.
The movement is repeatable (button continues to evade on subsequent hover/enter events).

requirements.text: Mobile interaction: when the user taps the "No üíî" button, it must immediately move to a new random fixed position within the full viewport and must never remain in the same place after a tap.

quotes:
MOBILE BEHAVIOR:

- When the user taps the "No" button,
it should immediately move to a new RANDOM position anywhere on the FULL SCREEN.
- The button must never stay in the same place after a tap.

acceptanceCriteria: On touch devices, tapping "No üíî" triggers an immediate move.
After each tap, the new position differs from the previous position.
Behavior works on common mobile browsers (iOS Safari / Android Chrome-level touch handling).

requirements.text: Click safety: if the "No üíî" button receives a click/tap event anyway, it must not trigger any navigation or success state. Instead, it must immediately move again to another random fixed position. Ensure reliable movement by handling mouseenter/hover, click, and touch events.

quotes:
CLICK SAFETY:

- Even if the user somehow manages to click the "No" button,
it should NOT trigger any action.
- Instead, it should immediately move again to another random position.

- Handle mouseenter, click, and touch events for reliable movement.

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking "No üíî" never navigates to the success screen and does not change app state besides repositioning.
A click/tap on "No üíî" triggers an additional immediate reposition (even if a hover/touch handler already fired).
The reposition logic is invoked for mouseenter (desktop), touch interaction (mobile), and click as a fallback.

requirements.text: Apply a cute, romantic, playful UI theme consistent across screens: soft pink/pastel red background, rounded buttons, smooth transitions, and fully responsive layout for mobile/desktop. Add slightly dramatic motion feel for the evasive "No üíî" button (e.g., quick jump with subtle transition), without introducing external UI libraries.

quotes:
DESIGN REQUIREMENTS:

- Soft pink / pastel red background
- Rounded buttons with smooth transitions
- Fun, dramatic movement for the No button
- Fully responsive on mobile and desktop
- Cute, romantic, playful vibe

Use only plain HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Do not use any external libraries.

acceptanceCriteria: Background uses a soft pink/pastel red palette and is applied consistently on both main and success screens.
Buttons are rounded with visible hover/press states and smooth transitions.
Layout remains centered and usable across common viewport sizes (small phones to large desktops).
No additional third-party UI/animation libraries are added beyond the existing template stack.

constraints: Frontend must not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose them instead if needed).
Do not edit immutable paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor; no extra backend services.
No external libraries should be added to implement the evasive button or animation (implement with React + CSS/Tailwind and standard DOM APIs).
nonGoals: Persisting any data on the backend.
Adding payments, messaging, notifications, or real-time features.
Adding additional pages beyond the main question screen and the success screen.
